6 - data.frame data.frame           .           (    )    emp_data    data.frame # Create the data frame. emp_data <- data.frame( emp_id = c(1:5), emp_name = c("Moshe","Adi","Michelle","Avi","Rotem"), salary = c(6300,9000,11000,8400,7500) ) # Print the data frame. print(emp_data) ## emp_id emp_name salary ## 1 1 Moshe 6300 ## 2 2 Adi 9000 ## 3 3 Michelle 11000 ## 4 4 Avi 8400 ## 5 5 Rotem 7500      . class(emp_data) # type of emp_data ## [1] "data.frame" ncol(emp_data) # number of columns ## [1] 3 nrow(emp_data) # number of rows ## [1] 5 dim(emp_data) # dimensions: c(nrow, ncol) ## [1] 5 3 colnames(emp_data) # columns names ## [1] "emp_id" "emp_name" "salary" 6.1           $     : some_data_frame$column_name         emp_id  emp_data emp_data$emp_id ## [1] 1 2 3 4 5         emp_name  emp_data emp_data$emp_name ## [1] "Moshe" "Adi" "Michelle" "Avi" "Rotem"         salary  emp_data emp_data$salary ## [1] 6300 9000 11000 8400 7500
